website_summaries.verdict: The Razer Blade is a slim gaming laptop that hits a good balance between power and portability, with the intriguing promise of adding a desktop graphics card later on.
pros: The Razer Blade fits very high-end components into a slim 14-inch body, and has a programmable multicolored backlit keyboard that can perform all sorts of impressive tricks
cons: Full-size gaming laptops can turn in better gaming scores, and configuration options are minimal
Adding the optional Core external graphics adapter is very expensive

customer_reviews.title: It is an amazing little guy
customer_reviews.text: If you understand this is not a logical choice price to performance wise and have the money to get it...get it. It is an amazing little guy. Also if you don't care for the chroma Keyboard of the Newer blade 14 this is for you. But if you want the chroma keyboard get the newer one. (I know I wish I waited a bit longer for it but had no idea it was coming). Probably best to stay away from the razer blade stealth because of all the performance sacrifices that had to be made and has a much higher screen resolution which I imagine will kill battery quicker and/or not perform super well.
customer_reviews.author: Darrtel

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't -worst customer service ever
customer_reviews.text: We were thrilled with the amazing speed of this gaming computer. For four month. And then it died completely and since then it's been two weeks of dealing with completely inept customer support at Razer only to get back a "repaired" laptop that also doesn't work. And we are unable to get a response or a resolution. Worst purchase I've ever made

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop. Crisp touch screen at high resolutions
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop. Crisp touch screen at high resolutions. The NVIDA 970M does a fine job drive most modern games at high resolution. Some fan noise with peak graphics demand, but that is to be expected. My only constructive input is these new ultra screen resolutions can really make some windows interface things too tiny by default, especially for anyone at the age requiring bifocals. I would buy another Razor laptop after this one.

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop
customer_reviews.text: At first it was very noisy, but then you get used to it. Especially since I mostly wear headphones, I hardly notice it. Although, make sure you don't leave anything too heavy running in the background, as it is very embarrassing to have your laptop rev up during a lecture/seminar/public space. Also, if you tend to voice chat your friends while you game, make sure you have headphones with a built in mic, cause they can hear your fans loud and clear!

Its very portable and is very lightweight. But the hardware in the computer is amazing! With a intel core i7 processor and stellar nviada graphics.
